item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Apple Mobile Processors Are Now Made in America. By TSMC (321 points | 129 comments)
2. Entire Independent Board of Directors of 23andMe Resigns (252 points | 117 comments)
3. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (365 points | 119 comments)
4. Atkinson Hyperlegible Font (329 points | 89 comments)
5. Scramble: Open-Source Alternative to Grammarly (18 points | 6 comments)
6. GraalPy – A high-performance embeddable Python 3 runtime for Java (210 points | 91 comments)
7. The Lego Great Ball Contraption (166 points | 25 comments)
8. Rga: Ripgrep, but also search in PDFs, E-Books, Office documents, zip, etc. (335 points | 31 comments)
9. Reports of the Death of Dental Cavities Are Greatly Exaggerated (56 points | 23 comments)
10. Show HN: Open Scanner, an open-source document scanning app for iPhone (175 points | 54 comments)
11. The Double Irish Dutch Sandwich: End of a Tax Evasion Strategy (153 points | 135 comments)
12. John Peralta Explodes Historic Technology into Three-Dimensional Diagrams (13 points | discuss)
13. Emerge Tools (YC W21) is hiring a senior front end engineer ( | hide)
14. A Friendly Introduction to Assembly for High-Level Programmers (65 points | 3 comments)
15. OpenTelemetry Tracing in < 200 lines of code (133 points | 15 comments)
16. Hezbollah pager explosions kill several people in Lebanon (691 points | 1587 comments)
17. Why Gauss wanted a heptadecagon on his tombstone (219 points | 48 comments)
18. STORM: Get a Wikipedia-like report on your topic (75 points | 38 comments)
19. WonderWorld: Interactive 3D Scene Generation from a Single Image (122 points | 12 comments)
20. Scrolling Text Display (17 points | discuss)
21. Launch HN: Marblism (YC W24) – Generate full-stack web apps from a prompt (98 points | 67 comments)
22. Exploring pre-1990 versions of wc(1) (2023) (16 points | 1 comment)
23. The centrality of stupidity in mathematics (221 points | 131 comments)
24. The port of the Windows 95 Start Menu was not all it seemed (3 points | 1 comment)
25. Show HN: Will I run Boston 2025? (42 points | 39 comments)
26. TexTube: Chat with any YouTube video transcript in ChatGPT fast (99 points | 64 comments)
27. Show HN: Finic – Open source platform for building browser automations (106 points | 63 comments)
28. In 1926, TV Was Mechanical (101 points | 30 comments)
29. Signatures of gravitational atoms from black hole mergers (109 points | 53 comments)
30. Rustpad is an efficient and minimal open-source collaborative text editor (8 points | 1 comment)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 4:20 AM UTC
